title: Introduction to Earth System Science and Planetary Boundaries

questions.question: What is Earth System Science?
choices: The study of Earth's geology only
An interdisciplinary field studying Earth as an integrated system
The study of Earth's atmosphere exclusively
A branch of astronomy focused on Earth
questions.answer: An interdisciplinary field studying Earth as an integrated system

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the major components of the Earth system?
questions.answer: Technosphere

questions.question: What term describes the proposed geological epoch marking significant human impact on Earth's geology and ecosystems?
questions.answer: Anthropocene

questions.question: How many planetary boundaries are identified in the framework developed by Johan Rockstr√∂m and colleagues?
Which of the following is NOT one of the nine planetary boundaries?
questions.answer: Volcanic activity

questions.question: What does the term 'biosphere' refer to in Earth System Science?
choices: The solid Earth including the crust and mantle
All water on Earth in liquid, solid, and gaseous forms
The layer of gases surrounding the Earth
All living organisms and their interactions with the environment
questions.answer: All living organisms and their interactions with the environment

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a feedback process in the Earth system?
questions.answer: Ice-albedo feedback

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the planetary boundaries framework?
choices: To define a safe operating space for humanity
To measure the age of the Earth
To classify different types of ecosystems
questions.answer: To define a safe operating space for humanity

questions.question: Which of the following is considered evidence for the Anthropocene?
choices: The presence of artificial materials in sediments
questions.answer: The presence of artificial materials in sediments

questions.question: What does the term 'resilience' mean in the context of Earth systems?
choices: The ability of a system to resist any change
The speed at which a system returns to its original state
The capacity of a system to absorb disturbances while maintaining function
The tendency of a system to become more complex over time
questions.answer: The capacity of a system to absorb disturbances while maintaining function

questions.question: Which of the following planetary boundaries is most directly related to agriculture?
questions.answer: Biogeochemical flows (nitrogen and phosphorus cycles)

questions.question: What is a 'tipping point' in Earth System Science?
choices: The point at which the Earth's rotation changes direction
A critical threshold beyond which rapid and potentially irreversible changes occur
The maximum temperature the Earth can sustain
The point at which all ice on Earth melts
questions.answer: A critical threshold beyond which rapid and potentially irreversible changes occur

questions.question: Which component of the Earth system includes glaciers and sea ice?
questions.answer: Cryosphere

questions.question: What is the primary driver of climate change according to the planetary boundaries framework?
questions.answer: Human-induced greenhouse gas emissions

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of land system change?
questions.answer: Deforestation

questions.question: What does the planetary boundary of 'novel entities' refer to?
choices: Chemical pollution, plastics, and other human-made substances
questions.answer: Chemical pollution, plastics, and other human-made substances

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a major cause of biodiversity loss?
questions.answer: Increased protected areas

questions.question: What is the primary concern with exceeding the freshwater use boundary?
choices: Formation of new rivers and lakes
questions.answer: Water scarcity and ecosystem collapse

questions.question: Which Earth system process is most directly affected by the depletion of stratospheric ozone?
questions.answer: UV radiation protection

questions.question: What is the primary concern with ocean acidification?
choices: Damage to coral reefs and marine ecosystems
questions.answer: Damage to coral reefs and marine ecosystems

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the concept of 'Earth as an integrated system'?
choices: Earth's components function independently of each other
Only the atmosphere and hydrosphere interact
All Earth's components interact through various processes
The Earth is a closed system with no external influences
questions.answer: All Earth's components interact through various processes

questions.question: What role does the biosphere play in the carbon cycle?
choices: It has no significant impact on the carbon cycle
It only releases carbon into the atmosphere
It only absorbs carbon from the atmosphere
It both absorbs and releases carbon, influencing atmospheric CO2 levels
questions.answer: It both absorbs and releases carbon, influencing atmospheric CO2 levels

questions.question: Which of the following is a potential consequence of exceeding multiple planetary boundaries?
questions.answer: Abrupt and irreversible environmental changes

questions.question: What is the primary goal of studying Earth System Science in the context of Timor-Leste?
choices: To understand and address local and global environmental challenges
questions.answer: To understand and address local and global environmental challenges

questions.question: How might climate change impact Timor-Leste according to Earth System Science principles?
choices: It will have no significant impact
It will only affect marine ecosystems
It may lead to sea-level rise and changes in precipitation patterns
It will result in colder temperatures year-round
questions.answer: It may lead to sea-level rise and changes in precipitation patterns

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of how the hydrosphere interacts with the geosphere?
questions.answer: Erosion of rocks by rivers

questions.question: What is the significance of studying local environmental changes in Timor-Leste within the context of Earth System Science?
choices: It has no relevance to global processes
It helps understand how local changes connect to global Earth system processes
It only matters for tourism development
It is solely for academic purposes with no practical applications
questions.answer: It helps understand how local changes connect to global Earth system processes

questions.question: Which of the following activities in Timor-Leste could contribute to exceeding the land system change planetary boundary?
questions.answer: Slash-and-burn agriculture

questions.question: How can traditional ecological knowledge in Timor-Leste contribute to Earth System Science?
choices: It is irrelevant to scientific understanding
It can provide long-term observations of local environmental changes
It only applies to agricultural practices
It contradicts all modern scientific knowledge
questions.answer: It can provide long-term observations of local environmental changes

questions.question: What role does the atmosphere play in Earth's energy balance?
choices: It has no effect on Earth's energy balance
It only traps heat, causing continuous warming
It regulates the amount of solar radiation reaching and leaving Earth's surface
It only reflects solar radiation back into space
questions.answer: It regulates the amount of solar radiation reaching and leaving Earth's surface
